ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: The event name for which the data was collected
Date of the night (PM portion of sleep period) of sleep being considered
Week number since start of protocol
Notes: Only first 3 weeks will be included in weekly aggregation (protocol length of wear)

ElementDescription: Day of the week
Is this day a weekend (Saturday or Sunday)
First day of (expected) wear by 3 week protocol
Is this day during the 3 week protocol period?
First Minute that the participant was identified as being in-bed (but not necessarily asleep)
Notes: All data is offset by 12 hours so that 00:00= noon;  23:59=11:59A

ElementDescription: First Minute that the participant was identified as being asleep
Notes: All data is offset by 12 hours so that 00:00= noon;  23:59=11:59A

ElementDescription: First Minute that the participant was identified as being out-bed (but may have woken up prior to this)
Notes: All data is offset by 12 hours so that 00:00= noon;  23:59=11:59A

ElementDescription: First Minute that the participant was identified as being awake
Notes: All data is offset by 12 hours so that 00:00= noon;  23:59=11:59A

ElementDescription: Total time within the sleep window (including wake periods) as calculated by 30 second sleep record
Total time in sleep (light plus deep plusREM)
Total number of Minutes (in 30 second increments) identified as being awake during the sleep window
Notes: Does not include any Minutes anotated as awake prior to the first Minute of sleep (i.e. does not count latency)

ElementDescription: Total number of Minutes (in 30 second increments) identified as being in "light" sleep stage during the sleep window
Total number of Minutes (in 30 second increments) identified as being in "deep" sleep stage during the sleep window
Total number of Minutes (in 30 second increments) identified as being in "REM" sleep stage during the sleep window
Total number of unique awakenings during the sleep period (excludes final awakening)
Average heart rate during Minutes that were classified as awake
Notes: In the event that the two (2) 30-second epochs within the Minute under review did not agree regarding sleep stage the HR for that Minute was not included.

ElementDescription: Average heart rate during Minutes that were classified as light sleep stage
Notes: In the event that the two (2) 30-second epochs within the Minute under review did not agree regarding sleep stage the HR for that Minute was not included.

ElementDescription: Average heart rate during Minutes that were classified as deep sleep stage
Notes: In the event that the two (2) 30-second epochs within the Minute under review did not agree regarding sleep stage the HR for that Minute was not included.

ElementDescription: Average heart rate during Minutes that were classified as REM sleep stage
Notes: In the event that the two (2) 30-second epochs within the Minute under review did not agree regarding sleep stage the HR for that Minute was not included.
